intro: Parrya nuratensis, commonly known as the Nuratensian parrya, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and bloom in early summer. Parrya nuratensis is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
